timeline.useractivity: diagnosed as TB, used medication for 4 days and stopped

timeline.diagnosis: HFrEF with EF= 32%, COPD, LEFT ULCER ON FOOT

timeline.useractivity: continued to consume alcohol, increased binge drinking since 10 days
timeline.symptom: cough, productive, low grade fever, SOB progressed to grade 4, orthopnea, abdominal distension, bilateral pedal edema
timeline.notes: patient had a history of alcoholic 180ml whiskey/day since 20 years, gutka consumption since 20 years

timeline.useractivity: experienced SOB grade 3, abdominal distension, bilateral pedal edema
timeline.symptom: SOB grade 3, abdominal distension, bilateral pedal edema
timeline.notes: patient had a history of chronic alcoholism and gutka consumption

timeline.symptom: SOB grade 4, abdominal distension, bilateral pedal edema
timeline.diagnosis: HFrEF with EF=27%, COPD, LEFT ULCER ON FOOT
timeline.treatment: oxygen inhalation, propped up posture, fluid restriction, salt restriction, inj. lasix, tab. ecospirin-av, inj. thiamine, neb with ipratropium, duolin
timeline.notes: patient was conscious, coherent, cooperative, afebrile, BP: 90/60mmHg, PR: 112bpm, RESP. RATE: 34CPM, Spo2: 89% on room air
pleural fluid analysis: volume - 3ml, appearance - clear, colour - pale yellow, total count - 10 cells, DC - 100% L, RBC - nil, others - nil

timeline.symptom: Sob decreased from grade 4 to grade 2, nocturnal cough, cough aggravated on lying down, swelling in left upper limb, thrombophlebitis
timeline.diagnosis: HFrEF with EF=27% secondary to ACUTE DECOMPENSATION ON CHRONIC HEART FAILURE
timeline.treatment: head end elevation, oxygenation, fluid restriction, salt restriction, inj. lasix, T. Met XL, neb with ipratropium, budecort
timeline.notes: patient is conscious, coherent, cooperative, pallor+, no icterus, cyanosis, clubbing, lymphadenopathy, BP: 110/70mmHg, PR: 100bpm, RR: 20/min, Spo2: 98% on room air
